Replace.Text: Enable [COLOR_Civ6DarkRed]EXTREMELY[ENDCOLOR] verbose log output for EGHV functions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This serves no purpose beyond troubleshooting, and should remain disabled unless needed.
Choose the maximum total number of reward(s) which can potentially be provided by each Tribal Village.
Zero (0) bonus rewards; this is the default setting.

Choose whether Hostile Villagers may appear [COLOR_Blue]AFTER[ENDCOLOR] receiving any Tribal Village reward(s).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When enabled, there is a chance for hostile villagers to appear following all successfully granted rewards from a Goody Hut.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This chance increases with the selected difficulty level, the current Game or Player Era, and the rarity value(s) of any granted reward(s). It is further modified by the manner in which any rewards are supplied and/or any units which receive any rewards.
Hostile Villagers will [COLOR_RED]NOT[ENDCOLOR] appear after receiving all allotted Tribal Village rewards.

Hostile Villagers will [COLOR_Blue]POSSIBLY[ENDCOLOR] appear after receiving all allotted Tribal Village rewards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Blue]IF[ENDCOLOR] they appear, villager hostility will be capped by the cumulative rarity of any received reward(s).

Hostile Villagers will [COLOR_MEDIUM_GREEN]ALWAYS[ENDCOLOR] appear after receiving all allotted Tribal Village rewards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_MEDIUM_GREEN]WHEN[ENDCOLOR] they appear, villager hostility will be capped by the cumulative rarity of any received reward(s).

Hostile Villagers will [COLOR_MEDIUM_GREEN]ALWAYS[ENDCOLOR] appear after receiving all allotted Tribal Village rewards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Villager hostility will be elevated beyond normal limits, and they will react with [COLOR_Civ6DarkRed]EXTREME[ENDCOLOR] aggression regardless of any received reward(s).
Choose which Goody Hut reward(s) have a chance of appearing.
Choose the distribution of Goody Huts on the map.
Generic description for the dummy reward.
Tier 5 (Specialized) Secrets-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The villagers provide the ability to construct, or additional benefits from, the [ICON_Buildings] Tribal Totem building.

Tier 1 (Common) Hostiles-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One (1) hostile [ICON_Barbarian] melee unit will appear nearby.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This unit may instead be mounted if [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horses are nearby.

Tier 2 (Uncommon) Hostiles-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One (1) hostile [ICON_Barbarian] melee and one (1) hostile [ICON_Barbarian] ranged unit(s) will appear nearby.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One or more of these unit(s) may instead be mounted if [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horses are nearby.

Tier 3 (Rare) Hostiles-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Two (2) hostile [ICON_Barbarian] melee and one (1) hostile [ICON_Barbarian] ranged unit(s) will appear nearby.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One or more of these unit(s) may instead be mounted if [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horses are nearby.

Tier 4 (Legendary) Hostiles-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One (1) hostile [ICON_Barbarian] melee and one (1) hostile [ICON_Barbarian] ranged unit(s) will appear nearby.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The villagers will also attempt to create a new [ICON_Barbarian] barbarian outpost nearby; failing this, additional hostile unit(s) will appear instead.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any unit(s) that appear may instead be mounted if [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horses are nearby.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Culture-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) random free [ICON_CivicBoosted] Civics.
Tier 3 (Rare) Culture-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) random free [ICON_CivicBoosted] Civic.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Culture-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) random free [ICON_CivicBoosted] Civic boosts.
Tier 1 (Common) Culture-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) random free [ICON_CivicBoosted] Civic boost.
Tier 1 (Common) Promotions-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any unit that receives this reward gains five (5) experience points towards its next [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Promotions-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any unit that receives this reward gains ten (10) experience points towards its next [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.
Tier 3 (Rare) Promotions-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any unit that receives this reward gains fifteen (15) experience points towards its next [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Promotions-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any unit that receives this reward gains twenty-five (25) experience points towards its next [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.
Tier 1 (Common) Diplomacy-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive ten (10) [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Diplomacy-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive twenty (20) [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor.
Tier 3 (Rare) Diplomacy-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive thirty (30) [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Diplomacy-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive fifty (50) [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Resources-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive fifty (50) of the most advanced strategic resource you have access to.
Tier 3 (Rare) Resources-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive thirty (30) of the most advanced strategic resource you have access to.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Resources-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive twenty (20) of the most advanced strategic resource you have access to.
Tier 1 (Common) Resources-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive ten (10) of the most advanced strategic resource you have access to.
Tier 1 (Common) Abilities-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The discovering unit(s) receive(s) +1 [ICON_Terrain] sight.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Abilities-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The discovering unit(s) receive(s) +20 [ICON_Damaged] healing per turn, if applicable.
Tier 3 (Rare) Abilities-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The discovering unit(s) receive(s) +1 [ICON_Movement] movement.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Abilities-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The discovering unit(s) receive(s) +10 [ICON_Strength] combat strength in all situations, if applicable.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Faith-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) random free [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic.
Tier 3 (Rare) Faith-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one hundred (100) [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Gold-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free additional [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.
Tier 3 (Rare) Gold-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one hundred twenty (120) [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free Era-appropriate [ICON_Unit] support unit in a nearby plot.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free Era-appropriate [ICON_Unit] siege unit in a nearby plot.

Tier 4 (Legendary) Promotions-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any unit that receives this reward will be upgraded to the next unit in its promotion class [COLOR_GREEN]IF[ENDCOLOR] it has a valid upgrade path [COLOR_GREEN]AND[ENDCOLOR] it has not yet earned any promotions. Any upgraded unit will retain any abilities it had previously earned.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any unit that receives this reward will be granted enough experience to earn its next promotion [COLOR_GREEN]IF[ENDCOLOR] it has a valid promotion class.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Invalid units will be skipped with no discernable effect.
Tier 5 (Mythic) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_Unit] Military Engineer in a nearby plot.
Tier 3 (Rare) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free Era-appropriate [ICON_Unit] heavy cavalry unit in a nearby plot.
Tier 3 (Rare) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free Era-appropriate [ICON_Unit] light cavalry unit in a nearby plot.
Tier 3 (Rare) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free Era-appropriate [ICON_Unit] anti-cavalry unit in a nearby plot.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free Era-appropriate [ICON_Unit] ranged unit in a nearby plot.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free Era-appropriate [ICON_Unit] melee unit in a nearby plot.
Tier 1 (Common) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free Era-appropriate [ICON_Unit] recon unit in a nearby plot.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Science-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) random free [ICON_TechBoosted] Technologies.
Tier 3 (Rare) Science-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) random free [ICON_TechBoosted] Technology.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Science-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) random free [ICON_TechBoosted] Technology boosts.
Tier 1 (Common) Science-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) random free [ICON_TechBoosted] Technology boost.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Survivors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_Unit] Settler in a nearby plot.
Tier 3 (Rare) Survivors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_Unit] Trader in a nearby plot.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Survivors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_Unit] Builder in a nearby plot.
Tier 1 (Common) Survivors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free additional [ICON_Citizen] Population in the nearest city.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Governors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive four (4) free [ICON_Government] Governor Titles.
Tier 3 (Rare) Governors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive three (3) free [ICON_Government] Governor Titles.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Governors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) free [ICON_Government] Governor Titles.
Tier 1 (Common) Governors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_Government] Governor Title.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Envoys-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive four (4) free [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.
Tier 3 (Rare) Envoys-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive three (3) free [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Envoys-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) free [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.
Tier 1 (Common) Envoys-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_Envoy] Envoy.

Receive an advanced unit produced from materials salvaged from a looted [ICON_Razed] meteor strike site.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward can only be earned from a meteor strike improvement; it cannot be earned from a goody hut improvement.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When Bonus Rewards are enabled, this reward will [COLOR_RED]NOT[ENDCOLOR] be a valid bonus reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When Hostile Villagers After Reward are enabled, hostile villagers will [COLOR_RED]NOT[ENDCOLOR] appear following this reward.
Enabling this option removes barbarians; by extension, it also overrides any 'Hostile Villagers' options, and removes hostile villagers entirely.
Enabling this option removes tribal villages; by extension, it also overrides the Goody Hut picker, and any other reward-related options.
Enabling this option gives most available Goody Hut rewards a roughly equal chance of appearing. Will be ignored if 'No Tribal Villages' is enabled.
